title: The Federal Reserve and Interest Rates
description: One-minute skill: The Federal Reserve and Interest Rates.

hook.text: One committee of 12 people in Washington sets the price of money for the entire US economy.

buildup.text: The Federal Reserve controls the federal funds rate â€” the base rate at which banks lend to each other overnight.

discovery.text: This rate ripples through everything: mortgages, car loans, credit cards, business borrowing, and savings yields.

twist.text: Raising rates slows spending and fights inflation. Lowering rates stimulates borrowing and spending.

climax.text: In 2022, the Fed raised rates from 0% to 5.25% in 18 months â€” the fastest increase in 40 years â€” to fight inflation.

punchline.text: When the Fed moves, every wallet in America feels it.

options: Borrowing becomes more expensive, which slows spending and fights inflation
